intro: Gymnogramma scalaris, commonly known as the scalloped spleenwort, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a small, terrestrial moss-like plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant has a distinctive appearance with its intricate, scalloped leaf patterns and a creeping growth habit. Gymnogramma scalaris lacks true roots and instead has rhizoids that anchor it to surfaces. Its simple structure and unique morphology make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
